overview_of_class: The purpose of this course is to guide students with the understanding and interpretation of economic data. There are many issues that arise when using economic data as compared to scientifically controlled data. Econometrics is the methodology used for solving these problems. This course is your basic introduction to econometrics. Course topics will include basic data analysis, regression analysis, functional forms, heteroskedasticity, serial correlation, and forecasting. We will be using actual economic data to address most of the issues studied in class. You will need to bring a calculator and ruler to class each week.
name: Introduction to Applied Econometrics
title: SCS ECON 281-CN-16 Introduction to Applied Econometrics

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value:
Texts may include the following. Visit the campus bookstore or its website to confirm materials for the course:

ESSENTIALS OF ECONOMETRICS
By GUJARATI
EDITION: 4TH 10
PUBLISHER: MCG
ISBN: 9780073375847

Notes and handouts will be distributed in class as a part of discussion.

subject: ECON
